Class LogServerApiActor

java.lang.Object
com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli.LogServerApiActor
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.CallableByActionName
public class LogServerApiActor extends Object implements com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.CallableByActionName
Actor that provides log server discovery API to plugins.

This actor wraps LogServerDiscovery and exposes its functionality through the CallableByActionName interface, making it accessible to plugins via the actor system.

Actions:

  • getJdbcUrl - Get JDBC URL for a database path. Returns TCP URL if a matching log server is running, otherwise embedded URL.
  • discoverServer - Discover log server for a database path. Returns server info (port, path) if found.

Example usage in a plugin:

// In plugin's connect method:
IIActorRef<?> logServerApi = system.getIIActor("logServerApi");
ActionResult result = logServerApi.callByActionName("getJdbcUrl", dbPath);
if (result.isSuccess()) {
    String jdbcUrl = result.getResult();
    connection = DriverManager.getConnection(jdbcUrl);
}
Since:
2.12.0
Author:
devteam@scivics-lab.com

    • getJdbcUrl

      private com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActionResult getJdbcUrl(String args)
      Gets the appropriate JDBC URL for connecting to a database.

      If a log server is running that serves the specified database, returns a TCP connection URL. Otherwise, returns an embedded mode URL.

      Parameters:
      args - database path (JSON array ["path"] or plain string "path")
      Returns:
      ActionResult with JDBC URL string

    • discoverServer

      private com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActionResult discoverServer(String args)
      Discovers a log server for the specified database path.
      Parameters:
      args - database path (JSON array ["path"] or plain string "path")
      Returns:
      ActionResult with server info (port:path) or "not found"

    • parseDbPath

      private String parseDbPath(String args)
      Parses database path from args.
      Parameters:
      args - JSON array ["path"] or plain string "path"
      Returns:
      database path string, or null if invalid
